page.title: 16HISTORY
page.content: EYNSHAM WAS ONE OF FOURÂ£TOWNS' CAPTURED AFTER THE BATTLE OF BEDCANFORD IN 571,BUT NOTHING MORE IS KNOWN ABOUT ITS HISTORY UNTIL THE FOUNDING OF THE ABBEY IN 1005 BY ETHELMAR,EARL OF CORNWALL.THE HOUSE WAS REFOUNDIND AFTER THE NORMAN CONQUEST BETWEEN 1091-1109 WHEN IT ACQUIRED POSSESSION OF THE TOWNS,VALUED IN DOOMSDAY AT 20 POUNDS. TO THE SUNDAY MARKET FIRST MENTIONED IN THE TIME OF STEVEN,HENRY 2ND ADDED TWO ANNUAL FAIRS.THE TOWN WAS EVIDENTLY PROSPEROUS,AND CONSIDERED CAPABLE OF FURTHER GROWTH FOR NEWLAND TO HAVE BEEN LAID OUT BY THE ABBOT IN 1215,BUT OF THE TOWNS SUSEQUENT FORTUNES WE KNOW NOTHING.ALTHOUGH IT WAS BADLY AFFECTED BY THE BLACK DEATH OF 1348 TWO MARKETS EACH WEEK WERE AUTHORISED IN 1440.THE ABBEY SEEMS TO HAVE RECOVERED BY THE DISSOLUTION WHEN IT WAS 2nd ONLY TO OSNEY IN WEALTH.
